DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study demonstrate superior intraocular pressure ( IOP ) control travoprost 0.004 % / timolol 0.5 % compare beta-blocker monotherapy participant open-angle glaucoma ocular hypertension .
DOC.criteria: Have clinical diagnosis either open angle glaucoma ocular hypertension . Currently betablocker monotherapy ( > 30 day ) would benefit , opinion investigator , intraocular pressure ( lOP ) reduction . Have mean baseline lOP > 18 mmHg < 32 mmHg least one eye . Must able understand sign Informed Consent form . Other protocolspecified inclusion criterion may apply . Use medication exclude protocol . Diseases , illness , infection , ocular abnormality exclude protocol . Ocular surgery procedure exclude protocol . Bestcorrected visual acuity ( BCVA ) score bad 55 ETDRS letter ( equivalent 20/80 Snellen , 0.60 logMAR 0.25 decimal ) . Hypersensitivity prostaglandin analogue component study medication opinion investigator .
